abstract.text: Displays a simple HUD window containing a progress indicator and two optional labels for short messages.

inlineContent.text: To still allow touches to pass through the HUD, you can set hud.userInteractionEnabled = NO.
HUD is a UI class and should therefore only be accessed on the main thread.

abstract.text: A Boolean value indicating whether the HUD is in the enable activity count.
Displays the HUD.
A label that holds an optional short message to be displayed below the activity indicator. The HUD is automatically resized to fit the entire text.
The HUD delegate object. Receives HUD state notifications.
Hides the HUD. This still calls the
delegate. This is the counterpart of the show: method. Use it to hide the HUD when your task completes.
Displays the HUD.
A layout guide that tracks the keyboard’s position in your app’s layout.
Removes the HUD from its parent view when hidden.
Find all unfinished HUD subviews and hide them. The counterpart to this method is
Creates a new HUD. adds it to provided view and shows it. The counterpart to this method is
The methods adopted by the object that allows your app to synchronize its drawing to the refresh rate of the display.
This is an activity count that records multiple shows and hides of the same HUD object.
The Progress object feeding the progress information to the progress indicator.
A convenience constructor that initializes the HUD with the
Calls the designated constructor with
as the parameter.
A layout guide that tracks the keyboard’s position in your app’s layout.
Refreshing the progress only every frame draw.
Creates a new HUD. adds it to provided view and shows it. The counterpart to this method is
A button that is placed below the labels. Visible only if a target / action is added and a title is assigned.
Called after the HUD is hidden.
Protocol describing the
extension points for HUD extended types.
View covering the entire HUD area, placed behind bezelView.
Creates a new HUD. adds it to provided view and shows it. And auto hides the HUD after a duration.
Finds the
HUD subview that hasn’t finished and hides it. The counterpart to this method is
Find all unfinished HUD subviews and hide them. The counterpart to this method is
HUD operation mode.
Grace period is the time (in seconds) that the invoked method may be run without showing the HUD.
HUD layout configuration. eg: offset, margin, padding, etc.
A boolean value indicating whether the HUD is visible.
A color that gets forwarded to all labels and supported indicators. Also sets the tintColor for custom views.
Set to nil to manage color individually.
Displays a simple HUD window containing a progress indicator and two optional labels for short messages.
A base view only provides one
method.
A layout guide that tracks the keyboard’s position in your app’s layout.
The view containing the labels and indicator (or customView). The HUD object places the content in this view in front of any background views.
Finds the
HUD subview that hasn’t finished and returns it.
The animation (type, duration, damping) that should be used when the HUD is shown and hidden.
A label that holds an optional details message displayed below the labelText message. The details text can span multiple lines.
A Boolean value that controls the delivery of user events.
The progress of the progress indicator, from 0.0 to 1.0.
Find all unfinished HUD subviews and return them.
A keyboard observer that tracks the keyboard’s position in your app’s layout.
Common initialization method, allowing overriding
When enabled, the bezel center gets slightly affected by the device accelerometer data.
The minimum time (in seconds) that the HUD is shown. This avoids the problem of the HUD being shown and than instantly hidden.
Hides the HUD. This still calls the
delegate. This is the counterpart of the show: method. Use it to hide the HUD when your task completes.

HUD subview that hasn’t finished and hides it. The counterpart to this method is
